intro: Brassica rapa var. purpuraria, commonly known as the purple sprouting broccoli, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact inflorescences that develop into purple-colored flower heads, which are edible and often harvested before full bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of 40–80 cm, with dark green, lobed leaves and a robust root system. It thrives in cool climates and is often cultivated for its nutritional value and unique flavor. This variety is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its vibrant purple flowers.
